prompt: <description>**Intermediate Part 1: A Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Next, create the 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. The sketch should consist of two faces: - Face 1: - Loop 1: Draw a circle with a center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.375. - Loop 2: Draw a circle with a center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.1172. After creating the 2D sketch, scale it using a scaling factor of 0.75. Transform the 2D sketch to 3D by applying a 3D rotation based on the euler angles and a translation using the translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction. Set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.3516 and set the extrude depth opposite normal to 0.0 to create a cylinder with a flat top and bottom. The dimensions of the cylindrical object are as follows: - length: 0.75 - width: 0.75 - height: 0.3516 **Intermediate Part 2: A Cylindrical Object with a Central Hole** Create a new coordinate system by using the first part's last operation translation vector [0.1362, 0.1362, 0.3516]. Keep the euler angles as [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Create a new 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch should contain one face: - Face 1: - Loop 1: Draw a circle with a center at [0.2388, 0.2388] and a radius of 0.2388. Now scale the 2D sketch with the scaling factor 0.4777. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles and translation vector of the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction: - Set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.3422. - Set the extrude depth opposite normal to 0.0. This operation will create a hole in the cylindrical object, resulting in a tube shape. The dimensions of the tube are as follows: - length: 0.4777 - width: 0.4777 - height: 0.3422 As a final step, combine parts 1 and 2 with a join operation to form the final shape of a cylindrical object with a central hole.</description>
